item.title: Cisco warns of ASA firewall zero-days exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cisco warned customers today to patch two zero-day vulnerabilities that are actively being exploited in attacks and impact the company's firewall software. [...]

item.title: Amazon pays $2.5 billion to settle Prime memberships lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Amazon will pay $2.5 billion to settle claims by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) that it used dark patterns to trick millions of users into enrolling in its Prime program and made it as difficult as possible to cancel the recurring subscriptions. [...]

item.title: Malicious Rust packages on Crates.io steal crypto wallet keys
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two malicious packages with nearly 8,500 downloads in Rust's official crate repository scanned developers' systems to steal cryptocurrency private keys and other secrets. [...]

item.title: How secure are passkeys, really? Here's what you need to know
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Passwords are weak links—88% of breaches involve stolen creds. Learn more from Specops Software about how passkeys deliver phishing resistance, simpler logins & lower support costs (with some hurdles to adoption). [...]

item.title: Teen suspected of Vegas casino cyberattacks released to parents
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A 17-year-old hacker who surrendered to face charges over cyberattacks targeting Vegas casinos in 2023 has been released into the custody of his parents, a family court judge ruled. [...]

item.title: Microsoft will offer free Windows 10 security updates in Europe
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft will offer free extended security updates for Windows 10 users in the European Economic Area (EEA), which includes Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and all 27 European Union member states. [...]

item.title: New Supermicro BMC flaws can create persistent backdoors
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two vulnerabilities affecting the firmware of Supermicro hardware, including Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) allow attackers to update systems with maliciously crafted images. [...]

item.title: OpenAI is testing a new GPT-5-based AI agent "GPT-Alpha"
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is internally testing a new version of its AI agent, which uses a special version of GPT-5 dubbed "GPT-Alpha." [...]

item.title: Kali Linux 2025.3 released with 10 new tools, Wi-Fi enhancements
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Kali Linux has released version 2025.3, the third version of 2025, featuring ten new tools, Nexmon support, and NetHunter improvements. [...]

item.title: Cisco warns of IOS zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cisco has released security updates to address a high-severity zero-day vulnerability in Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software that is currently being exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: Unpatched flaw in OnePlus phones lets rogue apps text messages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability in multiple OnePlus OxygenOS versions allows any installed app to access SMS data and metadata without requiring permission or user interaction. [...]

item.title: Police seizes $439 million stolen by cybercrime rings worldwide
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: In a five-month joint operation led by Interpol, law enforcement agencies have seized more than $439 million in cash and cryptocurrency linked to cyber-enabled financial crimes that impacted thousands of victims worldwide. [...]

item.title: Obscura, an obscure new ransomware variant
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Huntress Labs
item.description: Huntress analysts discovered a previously unseen ransomware variant, Obscura, spreading from a victim company's domain controller. Learn how Obscura works—and what it means for defenders—in this week's Tradecraft Tuesday. [...]
